intro: Vatica acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-pointed tonka tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces woody pods containing flat, aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ecological and economic importance, it is also a subject of conservation interest.
